msContents.summary: The Vētaviḷakkam, by Costanzo Beschi (1680-1747). See Trento (forthcoming). With a table of contents. Dimensions after cabaton (1912).

collation.desc: the front cover. Verso marbled. Shelfmark on verso.
1 folio = front guard leaf. No foliation. Recto marbled. Blank recto verso. Element of library binding.
1 folio = front guard leaf. No foliation. Blank recto verso. Element of library binding.
4 folios = front guard leaves. No foliation. Blank recto verso. Shelfmark on f[1]r. Element of original book.
156 folios = Vētaviḷakkam. Tamil foliation 1-156. Arabic library foliation 1-43, 45-157. The original book.
4 folios = back guard leaves. No foliation. Incomplete crossed-out library foliation on first folio. Blank recto verso. Element of original book.
1 folio = back guard leaf. No foliation. Verso marbled. Blank recto verso. Element of library binding.

additions.desc: BnF shelfmark in black pencil: Tamoul N° 481 (f[1]r).

Indication of the title to be displayed on the spine (inserted and bound in between u3 and U1):
Vedavilakkam
Tamoul. (Latin transcription).

binding.p: Leather (brown) cover. Title, alternating royal cypher and decoration on the spine.

origin.origDate: See colophon (U1, f152v2). Dated to 1750 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds (presumably palaeographical and material analysis arguments).

acquisition.p: It appears to be the paper Le Veda Velaccam. Livre de Controverses contre les hérétiques de Trinquembare and Veda Velaccam sent by the Jesuits of the Mission du Carnate in 1730 for the library of the king of France and mentioned in ancien lists (BnF NAF 5442, f5r and f9r).

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine (1912). Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 68.
S.n. (1739). Catalogus codicum manuscriptorum Bibliothecae regiae. Tomus primus. Pars prima, complectens codices manuscriptos orientales. Paris: Typographia Regia. — See n° XXV, p. 434.
Trento, Margherita (forthcoming). Writing Tamil Catholicism: A Social History of Persuasion and Devotion in the eighteenth Century.

encodingDesc.p: Transliteration conventions ― Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, and ē restored. Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only). ― Abbreviations ― c = column, f = folio, lf = library foliation = lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin, U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso.
